business.headline: Vedanta Q4 profit more than doubles: Check price target, FY26 estimates and moreWith expansion projects nearing completion and deleveraging underway, analysts believe Vedanta is positioning itself for a stronger, leaner phase of growth.

New ITR Forms 1 and 4 notified for FY 2024-2025. Check key changes, who can fileITR-1, or Sahaj, is for resident individuals who have an overall income of not more than Rs 50 lakh a year and the income is from a salary or pension, single house property, or income like interest from bank deposits or fixed deposits.

Ather Energy IPO: Step-by-step guide to check allotment status. See latest GMPThe electric scooter maker's public offer was just fully subscribed by the end of the final day of bidding, suggesting investors were not keen to put their money on another EV scooter maker, after Ola Electric's shares have not performed well since its market debut.

Accounting lapse, high-profile exits: What's next for IndusInd Bank?As the dust settles on IndusInd Bank's derivatives debacle, the real test begins: can the bank restore trust, steady the ship, and convince investors it's back on course?

Coca-Cola sells record servings at Maha Kumbh. The final number may shock youWhile saints and seekers looked for divine blessings, the world's biggest beverage giant looked across the Ganga's banks and found its biggest crowd.

Sensex, Nifty holiday: Are stock markets open for trading today?There are also no market holidays in the months of June and July 2025, so investors can expect uninterrupted trading during this period.

After Mother Dairy, Amul hikes milk prices by Rs 2 per litreAfter Mother Dairy, Amul has also hiked the prices of its milk up to 2rs per litre. The new prices will come into effect from tomorrow, i.e., May 1.

'Cash is king,' says Mark Mobius amid trade war fears, backs India over ChinaVeteran investor Mark Mobius believes that the uncertainty around the trade wars makes it risky to invest right now. However, he does see hope in countries like India, which he says could benefit as global supply chains shift away from China.
Sensex closes 46 points lower, Nifty below 24,400; Bajaj twins fall 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 46.14 points to end at 80,242.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 1.75 points to close at 24,334.20.

Can gold retain its glitter as Dalal Street gets back its glow?Just a week ago, gold was trading at record levels due to global uncertainty. Concerns over trade tensions, US tariffs, and geopolitical issues had pushed investors towards gold, a common choice during uncertain times.

New wave of IPOs is coming. Is Dalal Street ready?Tata Capital, PhonePe, and Zepto are also said to be in the pipeline. Financial firms like HDB Financial Services and Hero FinCorp are planning to raise Rs 12,500 crore and Rs 3,668 crore, respectively.

Rakuten to invest over $100 million in India, plans to boost hiring by 8%Rakuten currently employs 4,000 people in India, 90% of whom are tech staff, and plans to recruit people who it considers "power users" of AI.

entertainment.headline: Neha Kakkar shares her first IG post amid Melbourne concert controversyNeha Kakkar made a fresh post amid fresh claims from the organisers of her Melbourne concert. The singer supported her brother Tony Kakkar's new song, but wrote something which appeared a little cryptic. The post comes amid ongoing allegations that she lied about the reasons behind delays at the event.

Exclusive: Girl group W.i.S.H wants to collaborate with Jungkook, Dua LipaW.i.S.H, India's first girl group in 22 years, is making waves with their unique blend of Indian and global music styles, aiming to carve out a space in the international pop scene. The band discusses their journey, challenges, and aspirations in an exclusive interview

Deepika-Ranveer have a 'good time' at dinner with Instagram Head Adam MosseriPower couple Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh stepped out for a dinner night with Instagram head Adam Mosseri in Mumbai last night. Adam also shared a post featuring the couple expressing gratitude.

Chhaava actor Viineet Kumar Singh to welcome first child with wife RuchiraActor Viineet Kumar Singh, popular for his roles in 'Chhaava' and 'Superboys of Malegaon', is all set to welcome his first child with wife Ruchira Singh.

Raid 2 movie review: Ajay Devgn's film crumbles under weight of his stardomReleased-Thu May 01, 2025In 'Raid 2', you never get to meet Amay Patnaik, the honest income tax officer, because Ajay Devgn never gives in to the character. He appears like both Singham and Vijay Salgaonkar in parts, and drives a half-baked story.

Ajith Kumar turns 54, wife Shalini shares old pics from race-themed birthday bashAjith Kumar is celebrating his 54th birthday on May 1. His wife, Shalini, shared throwback photos from the race-themed birthday bash she hosted in 2024.

Ajith shares story of becoming 'accidental actor': Took up job to pay my debtsAjith Kumar, one of the celebrated superstars of Tamil cinema, called himself an 'accidental actor' in an exclusive conversation with India Today. He explained the story of how he took up acting to pay his debts from a failed business.

WAVES 2025 to kick off today in Mumbai, PM Modi to inaugurateWAVES 2025 will commence on May 1 in Mumbai. Set to be inaugurated by PM Modi, the four-day event will witness a plethora of keynote speakers from various walks of life.

Pope Francis's final interview to feature in Scorsese's film 'Aldeas — A New Story'Martin Scorsese is producing Aldeas — A New Story, a documentary focused on Pope Francis's Aldeas initiative, featuring youth films promoting cultural dialogue, as well as the Pope's final interview before his death.

Who is David Corenswet? Meet the actor playing the new SupermanDavid Corenswet, once a rising Netflix star, is now cast as James Gunn's new Superman. From humble beginnings to donning the cape, his journey marks a fresh era for DC films.

Instagram accounts of several Pak actors including Hania Aamir's blocked in IndiaOther Pakistani celebrities whose Instagram accounts have been disabled in India are Ali Zafar, Sanam Saeed, Bilal Abbas, Iqra Aziz, Imran Abbas and Sajal Aly.

Ajith opens up about his passion for acting: I have very strong work ethicsAjith Kumar, celebrated actor and racer, shared insights on his dual passions - acting and racing - in an exclusive interview. Recently awarded the Padma Bhushan, he reflected on his journey and future racing plans.

Janhvi Kapoor fumes over Jaipur drunk-driving accident that killed 14-year-oldA tragic incident in Jaipur unfolded as a 14-year-old girl lost her life due to a drunk-driving accident, prompting actor Janhvi Kapoor to express her outrage on social media. The accident involved a car allegedly driven by an intoxicated woman.

Countdown: Jensen Ackles-led show to premiere on June 25Prime Video announces the premiere date for its new action series 'Countdown', created by Derek Haas. The show features a stellar cast including Jensen Ackles and Eric Dane, with a premiere set for June 25.

Gram Chikitsalay trailer: Amol Parashar is on lookout for patients in rural taleThe trailer of 'Gram Chikitsalay' introduces viewers to the challenges faced by Dr Prabhat, a city doctor, as he attempts to rejuvenate a neglected health centre in the village of Bhathkandi. With a talented cast, the series is set to premiere on Prime Video on May 9.

Who's Costao Fernandes? Nawazuddin brings heroic life of customs officer to screen'Costao' tells the true story of Tony da Costa Fernandes, a brave officer who took down smugglers and paid a heavy price for justice. Featuring Nawazuddin Siddiqui, the film covers the themes of courage, corruption, and honour. Here's all you need to know about the gutsy customs officer.

Influencer slams Ranveer Singh, Nitanshi Goel, and celebs for disrespecting designersInfluencer Ishita Mangal recently called out Bollywood actors for showing disrespect towards designers during fashion shows.

Exclusive: Emraan Hashmi revisits India's most crucial counter-terror attackActor Emraan Hashmi discusses his role in 'Ground Zero', highlighting its focus on one of the most crucial anti-terror operation in early 2000s Kashmir, a volatile period marked by significant terrorist activities.

Met Gala 2025: What can Indian fans expect this yearMet Gala 2025 is just around the corner, and fans are quite excited about the same. With several prominent names from the Indian circuit, including Shah Rukh Khan, Kiara Advani, and more on the list, this year's fashionable event is shaping up to be a glamorous global affair.

general news.headline: Terrorists recced 3 Pahalgam spots, tight security foiled attack at park: SourcesA week before the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people, mostly tourists, on April 22, terrorists had conducted reconnaissance of three locations in the area on April 15, sources said.

Hafiz Saeed gets 4X security after J&K attack, Pak army deployed: SourcesThe Pakistan Army, ISI, and Lashkar operatives are jointly overseeing Hafiz Saeed's protection, sources said, adding that drone surveillance has been deployed to monitor the compound, while roads within a 4-kilometre radius have been equipped with high-resolution CCTV cameras.
India relaxes deadline, allows Pakistanis to leave country until further ordersThe order by the Home Ministry modifies its previous direction that said the Attari border would be closed on April 30.

India deploys jammers to block Pakistan aircraft navigation systems: SourcesThe Indian jamming systems are capable of interfering with multiple satellite-based navigation platforms, including GPS (US), GLONASS (Russia), and Beidou (China)-all of which are used by Pakistani military craft, sources said.

The 1989 un-Islamic kidnapping and chaos in the valleyIn part 4 of our series on the history of terrorism in Kashmir, we revisit the December 1989 kidnapping of Rubaiya Sayeed that encouraged thousands to hit the streets and bring the Indian government to its knees.

Rubio dials S Jaishankar, Shehbaz Sharif: India, Pak should de-escalate tensionsUS Secretary of State Marco Rubio spoke with Indian External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar and Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif amid rising tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people.

'Deliberately false': Elon Musk slams report claiming Tesla looking to replace himElon Musk responded furiously on X, calling it "an EXTREMELY BAD BREACH OF ETHICS" and slamming the WSJ for "publishing a DELIBERATELY FALSE ARTICLE" despite receiving a prior denial from Tesla's board.

Bizarre error sneaks into Bengal govt's Jagannath temple adA navigation map in a double-spread advertisement on the Jagannath temple in Digha issued by the West Bengal government and carried across India by newspapers had an embarrassing mistake. A location on the map read 'Female Vibrators in Digha'. The Pran Pratishtha ceremony of the Jagannathdham in Digha took place on April 30 in the presence of CM Mamata Banrjee. The temple has been seen as an outreach to Hindus.

Raid 2 movie review: Ajay Devgn's film crumbles under weight of his stardomReleased-Thu May 01, 2025In 'Raid 2', you never get to meet Amay Patnaik, the honest income tax officer, because Ajay Devgn never gives in to the character. He appears like both Singham and Vijay Salgaonkar in parts, and drives a half-baked story.

Pak's ISI chief gets key role amid tensions with India over Pahalgam attackAmid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan over the Pahalgam terror attack, ISI chief Lt Gen Mohammad Asim Malik was appointed Pakistan's National Security Advisor.

Even Nehru...: BJP counters Rahul Gandhi's 'welcome' reply to caste censusDharmendra Pradhan said Jawaharlal Nehru was against the idea and had described caste census as "anti-progress", accusing the Congress of having historically resisted efforts to empower marginalised communities.

High alert along Bangladesh border as Pak's ISI increases footprint: SourcesThe agencies have been told to be extra-vigilant along the Bangladesh border in view of the increasing presence of Pakistan's ISI and Pakistani military officials there.

Coca-Cola sells record servings at Maha Kumbh. The final number may shock youWhile saints and seekers looked for divine blessings, the world's biggest beverage giant looked across the Ganga's banks and found its biggest crowd.

Live: NIA chief visits Pahalgam terror site as attack probe intensifiesPahalgam attack live updates: Today marks the 9th day since the deadly Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people, mostly tourists. India is weighing options for retaliation beyond the sweeping diplomatic and strategic countermeasures already taken against Pakistan. These measures include the effective downgrading of diplomatic ties, closure of key border routes, suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, and expulsion of Pakistani military attaches from its High Commission in New Delhi. On Wednesday, Prime Minister Modi held a series of back-to-back key cabinet meetings. On Tuesday, he granted the Indian Armed Forces "complete operational freedom" to respond to the Pahalgam terror attack.

Delhi court allows NIA to record Tahawwur Rana's voice, handwriting samplesA Delhi court has allowed the NIA to collect voice and handwriting samples of 26/11 attack accused Tahawwur Rana, recently extradited from the US.

Flying hours, operation costs: How India shutting airspace will impact PakistanIndia closed its airspace to all aircraft registered, operated, or leased by Pakistan-including commercial airlines and military flights - from April 30 to May 23, 2025. The airspace ban is seen as a tit-for-tat response amid rising tensions following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack that left 26 people dead.
Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla suits up for Axiom-4 missionDuring the Ax-4 mission, Shukla will conduct seven experiments developed by Indian institutions.

WAVES Summit 2025 Live Updates: Shah Rukh Khan, Rajinikanth arriveWAVES Summit 2025 live: The event is going to begin in Mumbai today. Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate a first-of-its-kind four-day summit today. Follow the event live here.

Inside story of Congress's 'gayab' debacle: How a tweet sparked row in partyAccording to sources, the Congress's social media head Supriya Shrinate refused to delete the controversial 'gayab' post targeting Prime Minister Narendra Modi even after Jairam Ramesh and Pawan Khera intervened.

What Telangana does today...: Revanth Reddy praises Centre over caste survey nodChief Minister Revanth Reddy said Congress MP Rahul Gandhi was the first leader to seek a nationwide caste census during the party's Bharat Jodo Yatra and Telangana was one of the first states to implement it.

The singer supported her brother Tony Kakkar's new song, but wrote something which appeared a little cryptic. The post comes amid ongoing allegations that she lied about the reasons behind delays at the event.

Accounting lapse, high-profile exits: What's next for IndusInd Bank?As the dust settles on IndusInd Bank's derivatives debacle, the real test begins: can the bank restore trust, steady the ship, and convince investors it's back on course?

4 killed, 4 injured in Ajmer hotel fire; female firefighter among injuredA devastating fire in a hotel at Ajmer's Diggi market claimed four lives and injured four others, including a female firefighter.

Israel faces national danger amid raging wildfire, people abandon vehicles, fleeIsraeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu warned that the rapidly advancing flames could reach Jerusalem itself, calling it "a national emergency, not just a local one".

sports.headline: Mumbai Indians sign Raghu Sharma as replacement for injured Vignesh PuthurMumbai Indians spinner Vignesh Puthur was ruled out of the remainder of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 due to injury. The MI team management have signed Raghu Sharma as a replacement for the injured Vignesh Puthur.

RR vs MI: Can Rajasthan hamper Mumbai's winning momentum to stay alive?IPL 2025, RR vs MI: Mumbai Indians have a great chance of becoming the table-toppers, while Rajasthan Royals are looking for a win to stay alive in the competition.

Rohit Sharma reveals chat with his parents after Wankhede stadium honourIndia captain Rohit Sharma revealed that he has convinced his parents to come to the Wankhede stadium and watch his match from the stand named after him.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi has changed the momentum for RR, says Riyan ParagRajasthan Royals' interim captain Riyan Parag has lauded 14-year-old batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi for his maturity and impact on the squad.

Shreyas Iyer penalised for slow over rate against Chennai Super KingsIPL 2025, CSK vs PBKS: Punjab Kings' skipper Shreyas Iyer was fined Rs 12 lakh of his match fees after the four-wicket win over the Chennai Super Kings on Wednesday at the Chepauk.

Punjab Kings coach explains delay in signing injury replacementsPunjab Kings head coach Ricky Ponting has explained the delay in signing injury replacements, saying that the schedule clash with PSL has limited the availability of quality options. The team has been dealing with key injuries, as Glenn Maxwell fractured his finger during a training session ahead of the rain-abandoned match against Kolkata Knight Riders on April 26, while Lockie Ferguson has been ruled out for the season due to a serious injury.

Watch: Dhoni talks at length with CEO Kasi Viswanathan after early exitIPL 2025, CSK vs PBKS: MS Dhoni had a chat with Chennai Super Kings CEO Kasi Viswanathan after the five-time champions failed to qualify for the playoffs following their four-wicket defeat to Punjab Kings.

IPL 2025: CSK bowling coach Eric Simons blames Chennai batters for early exitChennai Super Kings' bowling coach Eric Simons admitted that his team had to improve their batting accuracy after being eliminated from the playoffs by the Punjab Kings. "We have been good at taking wickets, but as a team in our batting, there are a few areas where we need to find and to be more accurate around and what we need to do," Simons said. "It's all about being more accurate."

Trent Boult excited to go up against 'fearless' Vaibhav Suryavanshi in JaipurMumbai Indians fast bowler Trent Boult said he was excited to take on Vaibhav Suryavanshi in the upcoming fixture against the Rajasthan Royals (RR) at Sawai Man Singh Stadium, Jaipur.

David Boon retires as ICC match referee after remarkable 14-year stintDavid Boon retired as an ICC match referee on Wednesday, ending a remarkable 14-year tenure. His final assignment was the second Test between Bangladesh and Zimbabwe in Chattogram.

Shreyas Iyer has taken his game to a new level: Ricky PontingIPL 2025, CSK vs PBKS: Ricky Ponting lauded Shreyas Iyer after his match-winning 72 off 41 balls against the Chennai Super Kings took Punjab Kings to second in the points table.

"We have been good at taking wickets, but as a team in our batting, there are a few areas where we need to find and to be more accurate around and what we need to do," Simons said. "It's all about being more accurate."

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
